com.amazon.device.ads

Class AdTargetingOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.amazon.device.ads.AdTargetingOptions

  • public class AdTargetingOptions
extends java.lang.Object
    The configurable ad targeting options for each ad request.

    • Method Detail

      • enableGeoLocation

        public AdTargetingOptions enableGeoLocation(boolean enable)
        If your app or the device is enabled to provide the latitude and longitude coordinates, you can allow the Amazon Mobile Ads API to send these values to the Amazon Mobile Ad Network. Requests that contain geographic location may earn higher CPMs.

        Your app must include permissions for ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION and ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION to utilize latitude and longitude coordinates.
        Parameters:
        enable - Whether to use latitude and longitude information when requesting ads.
        Returns:
        The current instance of AdTargetingOptions.

      • isGeoLocationEnabled

        public boolean isGeoLocationEnabled()
        Returns the current value of the use geo-location option.
        Returns:
        The current value of the use geo-location option.

      • setGender

        public AdTargetingOptions setGender(AdTargetingOptions.Gender gender)
        If your app collects gender information from the user, then you can pass that information to the Amazon Mobile Ad Network. Requests that contain gender information may earn higher CPMs.
        Parameters:
        gender - The user's gender.
        Returns:
        The current instance of AdTargetingOptions.

      • getGender

        public AdTargetingOptions.Gender getGender()
        Gets the current value of the gender option.
        Returns:
        The current value of the gender option.

      • setAge

        public AdTargetingOptions setAge(int age)
        If your app collects age information from the user, then you can pass that information to the Amazon Mobile Ad Network. Requests that contain age information may earn higher CPMs. The age option contains an exact number for the age. If you have age ranges, we recommend using the average age of each range.
        Parameters:
        age - The user's age.
        Returns:
        The current instance of AdTargetingOptions.

      • getAge

        public int getAge()
        Gets the current value of the age option.
        Returns:
        The current value of the age option.

      • setAdvancedOption

        public AdTargetingOptions setAdvancedOption(java.lang.String key,
                                   java.lang.String value)
        Sets advanced options using String key/value pairs. The advanced options currently are:

        'ec' - When making AdLayout.loadAd(AdTargetingOptions) requests you can specify a floor price in micro-dollars. For example, if you wanted to earn a minimum of $0.85 per thousand ads returned, then you would specify '850000' as the value in micro-dollars
        Parameters:
        key - The advanced option key.
        value - The advanced option value. Passing null will remove the advanced option specified by the key.
        Returns:
        THe current instance of the AdTargetingOptions.

      • containsAdvancedOption

        public boolean containsAdvancedOption(java.lang.String key)
        Returns whether an advanced option has been set.
        Parameters:
        key - The key of the advanced option to check for.
        Returns:
        Whether an advanced option has been set.

      • getAdvancedOption

        public java.lang.String getAdvancedOption(java.lang.String key)
        Gets the value of an advanced option.
        Parameters:
        key - The key of the advanced option.
        Returns:
        The value of the advanced option. Returns null if the key isn't found.
